intro: Pelexia phallocallosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pelexia, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Pelexia phallocallosa is often found in rich, loamy soils and is a valuable component of native plant communities.
